Finding aid for
Blodgett Family papers, 1872-1953
titlepage.author:
Finding aid created by
Michigan Historical Collections staff

did.abstract: Family of Delos A. Blodgett, his son John W. Blodgett, and his grandson John W. Blodgett, Jr., residents of Grand Rapids, Michigan and owners of a series of logging companies active in Michigan, Mississippi, California, Oregon, and Vancouver Island. Correspondence, journals, cash books, ledgers, and maps of family businesses, including the Blodgett Company, Wright-Blodgett Company, Michigan-California Lumber Company, Michigan Timber Company, Hill-Davis Company, and Tidewater Timber Company; also personal correspondence and photographs.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

did.physloc: Portions located in offsite storage; prior notification required for access.

acqinfo.p: The bulk of the collection was donated by John W. Blodgett, Jr. (donor 4302), in 1965. A further accession was received in 1990 from the Grand Rapids Public Library (donor 767) which had been given the materials by Mrs. John W. Blodgett, Jr.

accruals.p: No further additions to the papers are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Blodgett Family papers, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: The Blodgett Family of Grand Rapids, Michigan were owners of a series of logging companies in Michigan, Mississippi, California, Oregon, and Vancouver Island. Members of the family included Delos A. Blodgett, his son John W. Blodgett, and his grandson John W. Blodgett, Jr.

chronitem.event: Delos A. Blodgett born, Otsego County, N.Y.
Delos A. Blodgett moved to Michigan and began lumber business
Delos A. Blodgett moved to Hersey, Mich.
Delos A. Blodgett and Jennie S. Wood married
John W. Blodgett born, Hersey, Mich.
Delos A. Blodgett began logging in Osceola, Missaukee, and Clare Counties
Blodgett & Byrne firm formed (lumbering in Roscommon and Crawford Counties, mill at Muskegon)
John W. Blodgett graduated Highland Military Academy, Worcester, Mass.
John W. Blodgett took charge of Blodgett interests in Muskegon
Tillotsen & Blodgett firm formed (Muskegon mill)
Delos A. Blodgett delegate to Republican National Convention
Delos A. Blodgett moved to Grand Rapids
John W. Blodgett took charge of Blodgett & Byrne interests
Blodgett began buying land in Mississippi
John W. Blodgett president of Muskegon Boom Co.
Jennie Blodgett died
Delos A. Blodgett involved in lumber manufacture in Cadillac
Delos A. Blodgett delegate to Republican National Convention
Delos A. Blodgett and Daisy A. Peck married
Blodgett Muskegon basin timber exhausted
John W. Blodgett and Minnie A. Cumnock married
Delos A. Blodgett delegate to Republican National Convention
John W. Blodgett took over all his father's interests
Delos A. Blodgett delegate to Republican National Convention
John W. Blodgett member Republican National Committee
Blodgett Co., Ltd., formed
Delos A. Blodgett died
Michigan-California Lumber Co. formed
John W. Blodgett director of Federal Reserve Bank of Chicago
John W. Blodgett, Jr. became member of business
Minnie Blodgett died
John W. Blodgett died

scopecontent.p: The collection, although still largely unprocessed, has been grouped into different kinds of records. These include correspondence, business records, maps, and photographs.
